definition: to amass/to accumulate/to store/measured quantity (such as area of volume)/product (the result of multiplication)/to integrate (math.)/to solve (or integrate) an ordinary differential equation (math.)/old/long-standing
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

sentences.english: The state is weak, even by Latin American standards.
sentences.chinese: 即使用拉丁美洲的标准衡量，危地马拉积弱难返。

sentences.english: Broadcast domestic animation market, after years of weakness, not to mention its derivatives.
sentences.chinese: 国内的动画播映市场，积弱经年，更遑论其衍生产品。

definition: the people's livelihood is reduced to destitution (idiom); a time of famine and impoverishment
the country weakened and the people empoverished (idiom)
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
ingrained habits are hard to overcome (idiom); bad old practices die hard
to engage in wars of aggression at will (idiom)/militaristic/bellicose
content to hold a small part of the territory/fig. forced to relinquish the middle ground/forced to move away
The people have no way to make a living (idiom, from Record of the Grand Historian 史記|史记[Shi3 ji4])/no way of getting by
